formattedAddress: 2207 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2207 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text:
Glad Tidings is a church that celebrates the scripture through examining it's hebrew context. This church practices all the Christian holidays, but the Jewish holidays as well. They believe that Christianity is a true extension of Judaism and you can't know one without understanding the other.

The pastor Donna Keyes, loves to teach with Hebrew scriptures and the worship leader plays that music that might make you forget your in church every once in a while.

The people are fun, full of artists, actors, outcasts, weirdos and misfits. When you look around it's truly hard to say if it's a black church, white church, hispanic church, its definitely not a typical harlem church. In fact, with a female white pastor, incredible young black worship leader, and hodgepodge of races and cultures in the congregation there is such a beautiful medley of people, the thought about what kind of church it is rarely crosses your mind.  -  That alone is worth the visit.

They occupy an old nightclub, formally called "ZipCode" in Harlem. It was the premiere night club in town, where the likes of Mike Tyson, Dogie Fresh and others were notorious to frequent.

There are a lot of churches in Harlem - A lot. And most people would ask, "why another church?"
Well, Harlem doesn't have any other churches like this.

After three years of coming, I'm a leader in the church now. If you go, come ask for Eric. I'd love to meet you.
